text: was a former Japanese football player. He played for Furukawa Electric from 1972 to 1975 and forced to retire due to kidney problem. Post playing career he became a sports executive and served as director in the Japan Football League until 2003. In his later years Kinomoto lost both of his legs due to health issues and died on 15 January 2017 at the age of 68."Ｊリーグ生みの親"木之本興三氏 死去 ６８歳 ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Association football midfielders Category:Japanese footballers
title: Kozo Kinomoto
